title: What is the best show to watch on Broadway? - Quora

response.answer_text: i’m not quite sure what to say but i will tell you a few of my favourite shows that are on broadway right now & a bit about them :) waitress - waitress is a MUST SEE. this show will change your life. it was written to perfection by the one and only sara bareilles! it is much a meaningful, deep and funny show which you must see before it closes on january 5th, 2020. beetlejuice - this show is so much fun! (from what i can gather from blasting the obcr and from reviews) it is everything you would want beetlejuice to be and more!! absolutely hilarious and the cast is talented beyond belief! mean girls - taking a classic movie to the stage is always difficult, but mean girls has done it perfectly! this show is amazing and the cast is incredible! it is so so funny & the songs are so good and catchy!!! it is also set in todays time rather than in 2004 which i found very interesting. wicked - a classic musical that is definitely worth the hype! it tells a bold, fantastical story of a young woman named elphaba (you may know her as the wicked witch of the west) who has green skin and has a tough life because of it. incredible (very vocally demanding) music and you leave feeling great! honourable mentions: the prom, be more chill, the cher show, aladdin hope this helps :)

It depends what you’re looking for! And I have bolded my favorite shows in each category! My personal favorites are “Dear Evan Hansen” and “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child”. If you want to see a “classic” show, I would recommend shows such as “Wicked”, “Hello Dolly!”, “Carousel”, “School of Rock”, or “Phantom of the Opera”! If you’re looking for a laugh, there is “Gettin’ the Band Back Together”, and “Mean Girls” is another fantastic option too. I also haven’t seen “A Bronx Tale”, but I’ve heard incredible things about it as well! If you’re a Carole King fan, definitely see “Beautiful”! If you’re looking for a heart-gripping show, PLEASE GO SEE “Dear Evan Hansen”, “Come From Away”, or “Waitress”. If you have kids or a family with you, see “The Lion King”, “Spongebob: The Musical”, “Aladdin”, or “Frozen: The Musical”. And you could possibly see “Anastasia” with them too. If you’re looking for plays, there is “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child” (which is INCREDIBLE) or “The Play That Goes Wrong”! These are just a few, and there are many other shows out there too! Let me know which one you choose, or if you need any extra detail on certain shows, just ask me!
